instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3478: What is 820-3478? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no SSD drive.
threads.message:
Apple hardware test showed error PPN001 there may be a problem with the power management system

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0SW_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL>    is compact to ground     

how to start searching wisely?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no SSD drive.
threads.message: the resistance to GND is 0.3 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no SSD drive.
threads.message:
That is a "perfect" short; luckly low enough to use voltage injection method.
Probably SSD controller (<CHIP>U8600</CHIP>), or a NAND chip; hopeless case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no SSD drive.
threads.message: I'm tired or blind, 5 amps and can't see anything.  motherboard from the iPhone in the MacBook ?☹️

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no SSD drive.
threads.message:
2informaticos just for curiosity - what would need to be done to replace nand on these? does SPI and CPU is involved? 
Sorry not meant to spam here...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no SSD drive.
threads.message:
5A probably is the indication of your PSU.
If is limited at 5A, it doesn't inject anything.
You have a pure short, which requires more than 10A at 1V.

Buy 24V/20A PSU, or 12V/40A (adjustable, of course).
I already posted links on the forum and explained why!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no SSD drive.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8600</CHIP>  died     :-(    
motherboard to be used as spare parts
after removing this <CHIP>U8600</CHIP> the short circuit resolved

Can you give me a link to those of the power supply you wrote about?
